Beginning today, Friday, May 8th, CCPSD is hosting a presentation of our first-ever online art fair. Carroll County's art students, from Kindergarten through 12th Grade, have been creating amazing artwork all year long. Normally, their artwork would be displayed in the annual Art Show at CCMS during the month of April. This year we were not able to have our regular Art Show. However, the county's art teachers wanted to share the wonderful work that had been created by their students. Therefore, they have created CCPSD's First Digital Art Show. The website displays artwork selected from every grade and school in the county.

This year, a fan vote has also been included. It will be open from May 11 - 15. The art teachers and students would greatly appreciate it if you would take the opportunity to view and share the site. There is amazing artwork that you won't want to miss. The show can be found at https://sites.google.com/ccpsd.k12.va.us/2019-2020-ccpsd-art-show/home

Just Play! Do you want your child to be ready for preschool or kindergarten, then "just play outside". Some ideas:

Ride a bike, trike, big wheel
Run, jump, climb, swing
Dig in the dirt, sand and water
Play with shadows, blow bubbles, build a fort/tree house
Use sidewalk chalk, paint with water,
Wash toys, play with water hose, buckets, rags and sponges
Play in a small pool, sprinkler, slip and slide
Have a picnic, eat a popsicle,ice cream, watermelon etc outside
Throw, kick, hit and catch a ball
Plant a plant, water it and watch it grow
Camp out in the backyard, catch lightning bugs, play games in the dark with flashlights
Play with squirt bottles, water balloons etc.
Fly a kite
Play in the rain and mud
Collect rocks, leaves, sticks
Look for animals and bugs
Visit a park, playground, pool, creek, pond etc
Sing and Dance
Play I Spy
Avoid TV, tablets, computers, phones etc
